basics.name: Kunle Sunday Oguntoye
basics.label: Ph.D. Student
basics.summary: Innovative researcher and data scientist with a strong background in civil engineering, artificial intelligence, and computer vision. Pursuing a PhD in Intelligent Infrastructure Engineering at Iowa State University, I develop predictive models and multimodal sensing systems for pavement performance, infrastructure monitoring, and digital twin applications. My expertise spans MLOps, UAV-based data collection, and geospatial analyticsâ€”bridging data science and engineering to enhance decision-making, safety, and sustainability.

work.name: Iowa State University
work.summary: Developing AI/ML solutions for infrastructure monitoring and pavement performance prediction.
highlights: Developed and orchestrated an ELT pipeline using Apache Airflow for batch processing and ingestion of Iowa DOT raw pavement performance data into Google Cloud BigQuery
Developed advanced SQL queries for fast automatic segmentation of roadways into user-defined road lengths in BigQuery cloud service
Developed high-speed predictive analytics models for forecasting pavement conditions using multimodal data, including maintenance text records and nationwide pavement datasets
Optimized machine learning models on cleaned datasets to accurately predict future concrete strength
Developed comprehensive buried utility interconnection knowledge database for AI-based fuzzy model, enabling automatic mapping without excavation
Developed web application using React and Django for utility engineers to generate underground utility maps, reducing wait times by 60%
Identified critical missing data in pavement infrastructure big data and applied LLMs alongside XGBoost to predict missing maintenance information
Developed automated object detection framework using Faster R-CNN and YOLO for drone-based utility asset detection

work.name: Iowa State University
work.summary: Full-stack geospatial platform development and drone operations for infrastructure assessment.
highlights: Designed and implemented full-stack geospatial data processing platform for Iowa gravel road analysis, enabling automatic localization of surface defects with high accuracy
Developed comprehensive data collection plans with GCP maps in ArcGIS Pro, improving data quality and operational efficiency
Operated UAVs as licensed FAA remote pilot, processing imagery into orthophotos and DEMs
Developed automated ArcGIS Python toolboxes for DEM analysis, reducing pavement inspection time by 70%
Coordinated with airport and local County engineers for regulatory compliance and safe UAV operations

work.name: Musco Sport Lighting
work.summary: MLOps pipeline development and computer vision model deployment for people monitoring systems.
highlights: Championed design and deployment of end-to-end MLOps pipeline using Mlflow, TensorBoard, and AWS, improving GPU utilization by 15%
Spearheaded data collection strategy, leading field teams in camera system installation across multiple parks
Collaborated in Agile environment, completing internship project ahead of schedule through iterative development and cross-team coordination
Developed optimized algorithms and scripts to stitch key features from dual-camera images with overlapping views
Developed end-to-end machine learning models on AWS using S3 and SageMaker's built-in algorithm
Conducted hyperparameter tuning on YOLOv5 for improved object detection of soccer balls in video frames

work.name: Seflam SGI
work.summary: Project management for engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) company serving Oil and Gas companies.
highlights: Championed 3D modeling of mechanical and safety equipment at Nigeria LNG facility using LiDAR and Leica Cyclone, cutting inspection time by 50%
Collaborated with project management and third-party logistics to track, monitor, and resolve project-related issues
Managed project bidding documentation, task scheduling, and comprehensive risk assessments
Selected as company representative at 2021 National Oil and Gas Conference
Designed and delivered training programs for new employees and interns on proprietary software

work.name: Nexant Consulting LLP
work.summary: Quality control and construction inspection for civil engineering projects.
highlights: Led on-site quality control for 50+ material batches; enforced compliance for concrete and rebar, reducing rejection rates by 18%
Conducted 40+ phased inspections across formwork, rebar placement, pouring, and curing; resolved 25 critical deviations before final acceptance

work.name: Morgan Omonitan and Abe Ltd.
work.summary: Structural engineering internship in Lagos, Nigeria.
highlights: Developed automated Excel spreadsheet with VBA macros for pile foundation design, cutting design time by 70% for 200+ piles across 5 bridge projects
Prepared detailed structural specifications using AutoCAD and Revit, ensuring 100% compliance
Modeled 5+ reinforced concrete and steel structures in SAP2000 and Robot Structural Analysis, reducing material costs by 12%
Performed 10+ on-site inspections, resolving 18 non-conformances before concrete placement

education.area: Intelligent Infrastructure Engineering and Computer Science

Thesis: A Practical Framework for Automatic Underground Utility Mapping
